bill_title: Honoring and supporting the Scotland Kuchen Feier on the occasion of its second annual event.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring and supporting the Scotland Kuchen Feier on the occasion of its second annual event. WHEREAS, the second annual Scotland Kuchen Feier was held in Scotland, South Dakota, in conjunction with the Scottie Stampede Celebration on August 6, 7, and 8, 2010; and WHEREAS, Jenna Neth of Scotland, the daughter of Kim and the late Richard Neth, was crowned the Kuchen Queen of the Scotland Kuchen Feier; and Sydney Schmitz of Scotland, the daughter of Rob and Lisa Schmitz, Haley Brunke of Scotland, the daughter of Wayne and Melodee Brunke, and Morgan Iwan of Scotland, the daughter of Kevin and Brenda Iwan, were the other contestants in the Kuchen Queen pageant; and WHEREAS, the Scotland Kuchen Feier, which included other such activities as a kuchen eating contest, a community worship service, and a German heritage meal, was sponsored by Pietz Kuchen Kitchen, Roger and Lori Pietz owners; and WHEREAS, Mary and Frank Bruna did an excellent job as co-chairs of the Kuchen Queen pageant and the heritage meal, and the Happy Memories Band, directed by Maurice Bueber, provided excellent music and prayer for the Sunday worship service; and WHEREAS, the Scotland Kuchen Feier was a successful celebration of the area's German heritage and of the official state dessert: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eighty-sixth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Legislature congratulates the Scotland community on the success of the second annual Scotland Kuchen Feier and wishes the community the best of luck with this event in the years to come.
